attributes.action: To over-rule and reinstate BBC News Reader / presenter Moira Stuart
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Newsreader Moira Stuart has been forced out of presenting early morning bulletins because she is too old, it was reported today. 

The 55-year-old blames ageism at the BBC for her being removed from reading the bulletins on Andrew Marr's Sunday AM programme. 

Ms Stuart, Britain's first black female newscaster, told friends she was "very disappointed". 

One said: "This was not her decision, it was the BBC's." Another added the move was a "source of great disappointment" to the broadcaster. Friends said Ms Stuart believed it was due to the fact that there are other, younger, presenters ready to take her place. 

I demand they bring he back, and drop this agest attitude!

She one of the most liked and respected news readers.

reasons: Outside the remit of the Prime Minister and Government
